Articles.Content:
Hello,

I landed a small probe on Eve and half of it sunk into the ground,I landed at a soft speed of 1m/s. This is the second probe I have had sink into the ground(the other one blew up and lost half of its legs). I don't have the same problem with other planets(like Duna).

anyone know why it does this?
You probably have the terrain detail set too low. Low terrain detail makes the game take shortcuts with where the terrain seems to be.
Or your probe just wants to get fuel extracts from Eve... Yeah, it's probably what he said. ^^^^
If you increase the details, the clipping might cause the destruction of your probe. Bummer.
This may also be a collider bug. BTW you can always edit the persistent file to put the probe a couple of metres higher, improve the rendering quality and start again the simulation session.
